description:
**Tool Overview**:

A PowerShell command utilized to identify the location of the Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) partition within the disk management settings. This command is particularly useful when addressing installation issues related to insufficient space in the recovery partition.

**Details**:

1. This command helps administrators verify the exact location of the WinRE partition on their devices.
2. It can be utilized alongside other utilities to ensure the recovery options are properly configured for successful installations of updates.
3. Running this command can provide insights into whether the recovery partition needs resizing or if there are any status issues affecting its performance.
4. It's advisable to execute this command before attempting any modifications to the recovery partition.
5. When combined with other commands, such as `reagentc /info`, it presents a clearer picture of the Recovery options available on the system.
